comment: Overall enjoyed Dr. Collier's class. Ochem is difficult but he really wants his students to succeed! Attendance is not mandatory, but as he said, attending class 66% of the time will not cut it. I recommend going to all the lectures and READ THE TEXTBOOK! It was very helpful to piece everything together. Definitely take his class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr.Collier is a great professor for ochem, this is a challenging class but he does provide you with the resources necessary to make a suitable grade. He is very forgiving on exams when it comes to big problems, he will give points even when you don't think you deserve them. Definitely go to SI sessions and take this man if you have the opportunity.

Dr. Collier was such a good professor, take him if you see his class is available!  His lectures are really organized, he provides practice/study guides, he is happy to help if you have a question.Some people think he goes too fast, but it is ochem, you gotta be prepared to study outside of class. I really wish he taught ochem 2.

Dr. collier is very knowledgeable and passionate about organic chemistry. He is willing to work with you outside of class to make sure you know the content. His lectures are kind of fast paced but organic chemistry has a lot of content to get through. The only thing is that I wished he gave us a practice test for our exams. Take him!

Collier is very knowledgeable and will work with you if you ask for help. The class is fast and you have to practice on your own (which he emphasizes), but you'll do well if you know the content. A lot of people say his tests are hard and he's a harsh grader, but I think he's reasonable with both aspects. Just make sure to go to class and practice.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Whoever wrote the review below is illiterate. his handwriting is better than yours probably. Don't defame my boi Dr. Collier like that.

Very fast and has bad hand writing so if you miss something the whiteboard is pretty much useless. He seems like he doesn't know what he's talking about and is just teaching something he heard someone say once. His quizzes are an easy grade and so is the homework, but the tests are hard though Ochem is a hard class anyways. Take someone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: This lab was the reason my Thursday's were awful. Collier is very anal about small things and will make you feel stupid if you ask a question or make a small mistake. It took a while to warm up to him for most students. The final is very tough, be sure to save every worksheet from each lab!

Great lecturer; he writes on the board rather than going over a PP. He uploads his notes as well. He provides a ton of resources to study and quiz questions often show up on exams. He drops two HW and two quizzes and the final exam replaced the lowest test grade. Exams are hard because its organic chemistry, but he's a great professor

He is a great professor, you can tell he really cares about his students. He was always very willing to help and did his best to build a relationship with each student. I wish he taught more labs/classes that I needed. He offered extra credit at the end of the semester and was a pretty easy grader

Dr. Collier is a straight up g. He's a bro who cares about his students. Most students can feasibly get an A or B with reasonable effort. Gotta read the textbook & buy the solutions manual (HW and test q's are pulled)

Also, if he likes your class (i.e. people show up and participate), there will be a special "treat" at the end of the semester...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Ochem is hard no matter who you take it with, but Professor collier is very helpful and a nice guy. I pretty much went to every single one of his office hours the last half of the semester but he was always eager to help. His tests are tough but if you put in the work itll pay off.

Dr. Collier = a GREAT professor. He wants u to learn & understand the material as u should put in the work. This is a 3000+ level class so expect the material is hard. The textbook helps TREMENDOUSLY. Make sure to work on the provided worksheets and watch the recommended youtube videos. You'll come out with an A if you put in the effort. I DID IT!!

Dr. Collier was a great professor. i recommend him x1000. the class is hard so you will most definitely have to put in the work, but as long as you do he does his best to try to help everyone to pass. he is very helpful when you have questions especially during office hours.

Absolutely adore Dr. Collier. This is his second semester teaching and he really learned from first semester. He wants you to do well and isnt here to trick you. If he teaches orgo 1 again absolutely take him!

The final for this class made this class suck. It felt like Dr. Collier did not adequately prep us for the final. The rest of the class was okay. Lots of lab reports, but the labs were interesting to complete. They take a while, so you'll likely be in class the entire time. Hit or miss depending on how you understand the content

Probably one of the best college professor's I've had for an upper level stem course. Don't get me wrong, the class is still cut-throat, but there's not really a way to make Organic Chemistry "easy", but regardless, he does a good job at making the content somewhat digestable. The tests are tough, but the practice worksheets ensure an A.
He is a really tough grader and does not care about students at all. he expects you to be flawless in your assignments while he makes errors a lot.
I took him for ochem 2 lab and he was a really tough grader! I would not recommend taking him.

He honestly is a very good teacher. He is nice and learns everyones name. this class is just super hard. the exams had like 5 multiple choice questions and like 5 open response which were worth more than half the test.

His test were hard with low averages they all had an extra credit assignment to get 10 points added to them. In the syllabus it says that one test grade of the three we take is replaced by the final and 2 quizzes are dropped but after our third test he said that the final will replace all test grades that it is higher than. Tough but very nice.

Save yourself the stress and your GPA do not take his class. This man is ridiculous with his expectations in the class. His test are impossible, people don't even finish because of how much is on the test. Our test averages were 52, 48, 40, and no curves. That's how bad his class is. I'm telling ya'll do not take this class. Take anyone but him!!!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! I've never in my life had the worst professor. You are constantly being tested every single week, his test are HARD!! Multiple choice, fill in the blanks, and short answers with only 50 minutes. He doesn't curve test ether. There's 7 quizzes, 10 homework, 3 tests, and a final. You're better off taking Haseltine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He's a really good prof for Ochem lab. He's a little harsh and not very clear what he wants with the lab reports, but if you ask him for help, he'll lead you in the right direction. If you don't understand Ochem, he can get frustrated but if you follow directions and read the lab manual you'll be fine. Definitely take him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Collier is a great choice for orgo lab. He is super helpful when doing the labs and is a fair grader. He'll answer your questions while making sure you understand the material. He's also a nice guy to talk to.
